alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 14 at 4:16PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by continuous rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in vulnerable, low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to persistent rain showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in some spots, with between half an inch to 1 inch more broadly. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Highland Beach, Oakland Park, Wilton Manors, Hillsboro Beach, Sea Ranch Lakes, Lazy Lake, Twin Lakes, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach Airport, North Pompano Beach, Terra Mar and North Andrews Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
